## Runtime.IResolveResourceTreeOptions interface

Options for configuring resource tree resolution.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export interface IResolveResourceTreeOptions 
```

## Properties

<table><thead><tr><th>

Property


</th><th>

Modifiers


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

[onEmptyBranch?](./ts-res.runtime.iresolveresourcetreeoptions.onemptybranch.md)


</td><td>


</td><td>

'allow' \| 'omit' \| [EmptyBranchHandler](./ts-res.runtime.emptybranchhandler.md)


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ Controls how empty branch nodes are handled during tree composition. - 'allow': Include empty branches as empty objects in the result - 'omit': Exclude empty branches from the parent object - callback: Custom handler that can provide alternate values or recovery logic


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[onResourceError?](./ts-res.runtime.iresolveresourcetreeoptions.onresourceerror.md)


</td><td>


</td><td>

'fail' \| 'ignore' \| [ResourceErrorHandler](./ts-res.runtime.resourceerrorhandler.md)


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ Controls how errors are handled when resolving individual resources in the tree. - 'fail': Aggregate all errors and fail if any resource fails to resolve - 'ignore': Skip failed resources and omit them from the result - callback: Custom error handler that can provide alternate values or propagate errors


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
